page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: The immediate area close to the school is part of a large 5,000 dwelling housing estate known as{STANHOPE.}This was part of London overspill re_housing in the late 60's. The Kingsnorth Road shows typical ribbon development of late '20s and '30s; the Tennyson Road area has houses of the post World War II era, re_furbishment has recently been carried out, in addition there are pockets of modern infill. Kingsnorth village has houses mentioned in 17C. Chronicles as does Sevington. For the rest, there are single farm cottages and houses of varying age from modern to middle ages. Many of these have been converted to modern commuter needs. One Pattison Farmhouse is typical with a building date of 1802.
